description.narrative: Den föreslagna insatsen riktar sig till institutioner, lokalsamhällen och barngrupper i Peshkopi, Burrel, Durres, Elbasan, och Tirana. Det huvudsakliga målet är att bidra till ett förbättrat förhållningssätt till barns rätt till trygghet/skydd och barns deltagande. Insatsen är länkad med tidigare och pågående projekt implementerade av Rädda Barnen i Albanien (Save the Children in Albania/SCiA) inom barns rätt till trygghet/skydd och beslutsfattande som relaterar till barn. Aktiviteter innefattar följande: 1 Träning för ombudsman-personal i barns rättigheter, skydd av barn från vanvård samt datainsamling och dokumentation; etableringen av nätverk av unga rådgivare som kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med ombudsmannen, kommer rapportera om barns situation och bereda en lobbystrategi; designa en standard för barns deltagande etc. Ansökan är presenterad av Rädda Barnen Sverige (SC Sweden) och kommer att implementeras av Rädda Barnen i Albanien. Rädda Barnen Sverige kommer att bistå med teknisk expertis och kvalitetssäkring i implementeringen av detta projekt och kommer vara avtalspartner för detta bidrag. Insatsen löper över 3 år och har en budget om 395,770 EUR (3 825 900 SEK). Institutionerna som kommer att vara direkt involverade i interventionen är: Ombudsmannens kontor och den statliga byrån för barns rättigheter.
The contribution aims at strengthening institutions and empowering community and children to foster child protection and participation.

The intended outcome is the following: Strengthened institutions and empowered community and children to foster Child protection and participation. The intended outcome is expected to be fulfilled by working in three levels:1) increasing the capacities of the state institutions and independent bodies such as Ombudsman and State Agency for Child Rights; 2) mobilising communities and helping Children involvement in monitoring national/international mechanisms and 3) formalising all these processes in approved standards of child participation.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

description.narrative: Save the Children Albania has lobbied since 2016 for the establishment of a Child Rights Protection and Promotion Section (CRPPS) under the People’s Advocate Institution/Ombudsperson in Albania. The Albanian Parliament appointed in 2018 the first Commissioner of the CRPPS. Save the Children has promoted the role of CRPPS at central and local level and has supported the capacity development of the section. With the support from the project, a strategic and action plan for the CRPPS covering 2019-2022 has been developed. Here below are presented some examples of concrete effect of the cooperation with the CRPPS: - The number of child related cases handled by the Ombudsperson institution has been increasing steadily, from 68 in 2017 to 95 in 2019. - During 2020, 51% of all reported cases were dealing with child rights violations and were addressed by Ombudsperson Institution. (99 addressed cases out of 195 cases in total). - Annual reports produced by the Ombudsperson have special sections dealing with children’s rights protection and promotion of their rights. In the framework of the project, a survey and report on the views and experiences of young people was prepared, ”Young Voices 2017, Albania” This report was the voice of the children for the children and collected information on the needs of Albanian children and the gaps they see in their rights and they brought their voice in the table. The young voices report was used as useful tool in discussions with politicians, policy makers and other stakeholders at local and country level. The findings of the report were used for advocacy and contributed to prepare the UPR report; one activity plan with specific objective for each region was prepared which became the basis for children to lobby for their rights. In some cases, their requests were considered such as the security cameras in the schools and the reconstruction of some schools. Two advocacy meetings were organized in the parliament. Many children got involved in the process of survey design and data collection. They gained skills on methodology data. In 2020, the Young Voices Report was followed by a mini-report focusing on COVID-19, involving four locations covered in this project: Burrel, Elbasan, Peshkopi and Durrës. Save the Children supported participation of children in the latest UN Universal Periodic Review/UPR of Albania. A boy and a girl from Voice-16 (children groups supported by Save the Children) engaged and participated in the UPR pre-session in 2019. The recommendations made by the children have been accepted by the Albanian government. The report presented by the children has been broadly promoted. The Ministry of Health and Social Protection approved the guidelines General Criteria of Child Participation as a consolidated document in full compliance with the legislative requirements and the National Agenda for Children 2017-2020.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
